byline.docAuthor:
YOKO HAYASHI,
TOMOKO YANO and SHOZO YAMAMOTO

byline.affiliation:
Department of Biochemistry,
Tokushima University School of Medicine,

front.div:
Summary
An enzyme immunoassay for prostaglandin Fza was developed in which the
hapten molecule was labeled with alkaline phosphatase protein. After competi-
tion between the enzyme-labeled prostaglandin Fzo, and the free prostaglandin
F in their immunoreaction with prostaglandin F,,-specific antiserum, the
ar%genantibody conjugate was precipitated by the double antibody method,
and the activity of precipitated alkaline phosphatase was determined. Calibra-
tion curves of enzyme activity versus the amount of added prostaglandin Fzo,
were constructed. Under optimal conditions of pH, buffer concentration, incu-
bation time and amount of antibody and enzyme-labeled antigen, prostaglandin
Fzcl could be measured quantitatively in the range of 0.5 pmol to 1 nmol. This
method was applied for the determinations of prostaglandin Fzo, added to
urine.
__-_
